column4: hi, what is the command to find a folder? i can't seem to find "phpmyadmin" folder. anyone know where it is located?
if you installed it from repos, it should be at http://localhost/phpmyadmin (but its a redirect or something, so it doesnt live in /var/www, check the apache config files)
yup i installed it from the repo. i get an error message when i enter that in the url bar. i guess something is wrong..
what error do you get ? does http://localhost work ?
something to do with Port 80..localhost is fine.
hmm, is it an error _in_ the browser or do you get a popup window with the error ? could you paste that error on some paste service ?
here's the link: http://paste.ubuntu.com/23328/. thanks for helping..
are you sure phpmyadmin is installed ? try: sudo apt-get install phpmyadmin
yup it is installed. says the one installed it already the latest.
then try: sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 restart (i assume you installed apache2)
can you please check this out: http://paste.ubuntu.com/23330/..thanks
you can ignore that warning, but there is a fix for that too, but forgot... debian-administration.org has it... now try http
hmm, and your system is ubuntu 8.04 and it is up to date ?
